III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Criminal history check, subject to requirements; staff qualifications
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4112
Section (4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the following:
Description (a) Ability to perform duties of the position assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation In mid-April 2024 Desk Clerk allegedly sent a nude video of
herself to Former Youth J after he was discharged from the
facility.
Investigation MISACWIS indicates Youth J was discharged from Mott
Residence on 3/21/24 and placed at Methodist Children’s Home.
Interviews:
On 4/22/24 I notified Youth J’s Foster Care Worker via email of
the assigned investigation and later we spoke on the phone. He
expressed no additional licensing concerns and said he approved
Former Youth J and Staff 2 to maintain contact after Youth J was
discharged.
I interviewed Staff 2 jointly with Government Worker via phone on
4/22/24. He said he talks to Former Youth J almost daily by
phone. Staff 2 said Former Youth J told him that Former Youth C
(now placed with a relative) received a video from Desk Clerk via
Instagram. Former Youth C forwarded the video to Former Youth
J who in turn forwarded it him (Staff 2). Staff 2 said he still had
the video, and we asked him to retain it for law enforcement. He
said the video is 14 seconds long and shows a woman completely
2

nude who he identified as Desk Clerk. Staff 2 denied that he had
or has any type of relationship with Desk Clerk outside of the
facility. “We just worked together…only in a professional
capacity.” He mentioned that previously another former female
staff at Mott was also suspected of inappropriate behaviors with
Former Youth C. However, that allegation was made when Youth
C and that female staff were still at the facility together and was
investigated by Consultant 2 in SIR 2024SIC0001185.
On 4/22/24 I contacted Human Resources (HR) Director who
said she was already aware of the allegation. She said she
placed Desk Clerk on administrative leave on 4/20/24 and
terminated her on 4/23/24. HR Director stated Mott does not have
a policy prohibiting staff from contacting former youth.
I collaborated with Government Worker who completed a well-
being check on Former Youth J at Methodist Children’s Home and
notified law enforcement. Government Worker requested a
forensic interview of Former Youth C.
I interviewed Former Youth J jointly with Government Worker via
phone on 4/22/24. He expressed no concerns at his current
placement. Former Youth J said he prefers Methodist to Mott
because it is less restrictive. He said he does not own a cell
phone but has access to a computer for on-line school. Former
Youth J was not asked about the allegation at this time as not to
interfere with a potential police investigation.
Former Youth C was interviewed by Forensic Interviewer at
Voices on 5/14/24 while Government Worker and I observed via
Zoom. Former Youth C described Mott Residential as “cool” and
listed the daily routine. He said there were “good” staff there and
one male staff he disliked.
Former Youth C was unaware of any staff being fired at Mott
Residence. He said the other youths there were “pretty cool” but
they did not like the food or bedtime. Since he was discharged,
Former Youth C said he has kept in contact with two male staff via
text and has spoken with four former youths. He did not identify
Former Youth J as someone he communicated with. Former
Youth C did not know why he was being interviewed. “They don’t
give me the allegations. Whatever it is, I don’t care about it. I want
to go to the mall tomorrow.”
I interviewed Residential Director (RD) jointly with Government
Worker on 5/22/24 via phone. She has worked at Mott Residence
3

for 16 years. RD said Staff 2 forwarded to her via text an explicit
video he received third hand from Former Youth J. She viewed
the video and said the woman in it appeared to be Desk Clerk.
Desk Clerk’s employment was terminated immediately. Previous
to being a Desk Clerk, RD said the former staff worked as a Direct
Care Worker on the residential units. RD said there were no
concerns raised about her during her time in that role.
I interviewed Staff 2 again jointly with Government Worker on
5/22/24 via phone. Staff 2 confirmed he texted the video to RD
and still has the video on his phone.
Government Worker provided law enforcement with Staff 2’s direct
contact information if they wish to obtain the video from Staff 2.
On 6/5/24 Government Worker informed me that law enforcement
has permitted us to interview Former Youth J and Former Youth C
regarding the specific allegation.
I interviewed Former Youth J again on 6/5/24 jointly with
Government Worker via phone. Asked if he knew anything about
a video, he asked “What kind of video?” Government Worker
responded, “An adult video.” Former Youth J responded, “I heard
about it from people in general after leaving Whaley (Mott). I
didn’t see it.” Asked if he knew the content of the video, Former
Youth J said, “Desk Clerk nude, I think. I told Staff 2 because it
was weird.” Asked to provide names of who told him about a
video. Former Youth J said, “I heard Desk Clerk sent it to Youth C
after he left. We couldn’t have phones at Whaley (Mott).” Then
Former Youth J asked, “Can she (Desk Clerk) get in trouble for
that or go to jail?” Government Worker responded that he did not
know. I asked Former Youth H how he knows there was a video if
he never saw it. He answered, “I don’t know. I never seen it.”
Former Youth J denied receiving a video from Former Youth C
and denied sending it to Staff 2. Asked about his interactions with
Desk Clerk when he was at Mott, Former Youth J said he barely
saw her or knew her.
Government Worker and I interviewed Former Youth C jointly on
6/5/24 via phone. He denied seeing a nude video of any staff or
former staff from Mott. He denied receiving a video from anyone
or sending a video to anyone. When he was at Mott, he said he
knew Desk Clerk, but has not corresponded with after he was
discharged. Former Youth C said he still sometimes sends and
receives texts from a few Mott staff, but the conversations are
appropriate.
4

On 6/17/24 Government Worker discussed the allegation and
interviewed Former Desk Clerk at McDonald’s in Burton. Former
Desk Clerk denied she ever sent a video or photo of herself nude
to any resident or former resident. However, in October or
November 2023 she said she did send a nude video of herself to
Staff 2, who at the time, she considered dating. Former Desk
Clerk described the video as a selfie taken in a mirror. She said
she takes full responsibility for sending the video to an adult staff
member, it cost her her job and now she feels embarrassed and
humiliated. Former Desk Clerk denied having any contact with
Former Youth C or Former Youth J after they were discharged.
Government Worker had no findings.
Analysis Staff 2’s, Former Youth J’s, Former Youth C’s and Former Desk
Clerk’s accounts of the incident were inconsistent with one
another. Staff 2 said Former Youth J forwarded him a nude video
of Former Desk Clerk that had been forwarded to Former Youth J
from Former Youth C. Former Youth J denied ever seeing the
video, receiving it from Former Youth C or sending it to Staff 2. A
forensic interview of Former Youth C on 5/14/24 did not reveal any
information relative to the allegation. On 6/5/24 Former Youth C
told me and Government Worker that he never saw a video of
anyone, never received a video from anyone and never forwarded
a video to anyone. Former Desk Clerk said she sent a nude video
of herself to Staff 2 last October or November but never sent
anything to Former Youth J or Former Youth C.
CONSULTATION
I recommend Mott Children’s Residence prohibit communication
between staff and former youths once the youths are discharged.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules.
